item.title: How the U.S. and Mexico Drove Border Crossings Down in an Election Year
item.description: Illegal crossings have plummeted to the lowest monthly level since 2020. But the situation might not last.

item.title: Stock Futures Plunge as Global Selloff Intensifies
item.description: The worldwide stock-market selloff deepened, Nasdaq and S&P 500 futures tumbled, and bitcoin slid.

item.title: 2024's Most Popular Trades Are Unraveling
item.description: Some on Wall Street worry the Fed waited too long to cut rates.

item.title: Stock Futures Plunge as Global Selloff Intensifies
item.description: The worldwide stock-market selloff deepened, Nasdaq and S&P 500 futures tumbled, and bitcoin slid.

item.title: Woodside to Buy Ammonia Plant From OCI Global for $2.35 Billion
item.description: Woodside Energy will buy an ammonia plant under construction in Texas for around $2.35 billion as it seeks greener assets to balance a portfolio that generates most of its profits from oil and natural gas production.

item.title: L'Oreal Buys Stake in Swiss Skincare Company Galderma
item.description: The French cosmetics giant said it was acquiring a 10% stake, valued at roughly $1.9 billion based on Friday’s closing stock price.

item.title: Iran rejected U.S. and Arab efforts to temper its response to the killing in Tehran of Hamas's top political leader, as authorities investigated the security breaches that led to the attack.
item.description: Iran rejected U.S. and Arab efforts to temper its response to the killing in Tehran of Hamas’s top political leader, as authorities investigated the security breaches that led to the attack.

item.title: The protracted war in Gaza and long-running exchanges of fire with regional militias are taking a toll on Israeli reservists in the form of exhaustion and financial hardship.
item.description: The protracted war in Gaza and long-running exchanges of fire with regional militias are taking a toll on Israeli reservists in the form of exhaustion and financial hardship.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei Posts Biggest Single-Day Fall Since 1987 After Weak U.S. Data
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average closed down 12.4%, a historic fall triggered by disappointing U.S. jobs data and a further rise in the yen.

item.title: Infineon Cuts Guidance Again as Chip Glut Weighs on Recovery
item.description: Infineon lowered its sales forecasts for the third time this year as the inventory glut that is pervading the semiconductor industry continues to translate into fewer orders for chips in smartphones, cars and industrial machinery.

item.title: Societe Generale to Sell U.K., Swiss Private Banks for $982 Million
item.description: The French bank said it signed agreements with the Swiss-bank Union Bancaire Privee to sell SG Kleinwort Hambros and Societe Generale Private Banking Suisse.

item.title: Australia Raises Terrorism Threat Level
item.description: Authorities say more young people are turning to racially or religiously inspired violence.

item.title: Harris, on track to become the Democrats' formal nominee for president, was expected to declare her choice of running mate ahead of a first joint appearance scheduled for Tuesday in Philadelphia.
item.description: Harris, on track to become the Democrats’ formal nominee for president, was expected to declare her choice of running mate ahead of a first joint appearance scheduled for Tuesday in Philadelphia.

item.title: The IRS's first big batch of rejected claims of a controversial pandemic-era tax credit contains obvious mistakes by the government, tax advisers said.
item.description: The IRS’s first big batch of rejected claims of a controversial pandemic-era tax credit contains obvious mistakes by the government, tax advisers said.

item.title: Dozens of people were killed in protests throughout Bangladesh, as demonstrators called for the prime minister's resignation after weeks of violent upheaval led by student protesters rocked the country.
item.description: Dozens of people were killed in protests throughout Bangladesh, as demonstrators called for the prime minister’s resignation after weeks of violent upheaval led by student protesters rocked the country.

item.title: Ukraine said it sank a Russian submarine off the coast of occupied Crimea in a missile strike that would be a signature blow against Moscow's embattled fleet there.
item.description: Ukraine said it sank a Russian submarine off the coast of occupied Crimea in a missile strike that would be a signature blow against Moscow’s embattled fleet there.

item.title: Defense Secretary Austin canceled the plea bargain resolving the case against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and two other Guantanamo detainees accused of orchestrating the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.
item.description: Defense Secretary Austin canceled the plea bargain resolving the case against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and two other Guantanamo detainees accused of orchestrating the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Leaders of some of the biggest companies see signs of trouble in the world's two biggest economies, identifying a pullback in consumer spending in the U.S. and China.
item.description: Leaders of some of the biggest companies see signs of trouble in the world’s two biggest economies, identifying a pullback in consumer spending in the U.S. and China.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway said it sold nearly half its Apple shares in the second quarter, helping boost its cash hoard to a record $276.94 billion, including cash equivalents.
item.description: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway said it sold nearly half its Apple shares in the second quarter, helping boost its cash hoard to a record $276.94 billion, including cash equivalents.
